com.googlecode.streamflyer.util

Class ModificationFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.streamflyer.util.ModificationFactory
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ModificationFactoryDecorator

    public class ModificationFactory
extends Object
    This class creates AfterModification instances for the use cases that are often needed by implementations of Modifier.

    This class creates AfterModification instances for the most common use cases, see

    • modifyAgainImmediately(int, int)
    • fetchMoreInput(int, StringBuilder, int, boolean)
    • skipOrStop(int, StringBuilder, int, boolean)
    • #stop()
    Since:
    27.06.2011
    Author:
    rwoo

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AfterModification fetchMoreInput(int numberOfCharactersToSkip, StringBuilder characterBuffer, int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer, boolean endOfStreamHit)
      This method skips the given characters to use the character buffer as optimal as possible, checks whether skipping and the current value of AfterModification.getNewNumberOfChars() would fetch more input in the character buffer.
      int getNewNumberOfChars() 
      AfterModification modifyAgainImmediately(int newNumberOfChars_, int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer)
      Use this method if you want to request another number of characters from the ModifyingReader and re-try a modification (MODIFY AGAIN IMMEDIATELY).

      Skips some characters if there are some in the buffer.
      AfterModification skipEntireBuffer(StringBuilder characterBuffer, int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer, boolean endOfStreamHit) 
      AfterModification skipOrStop(int numberOfCharactersToSkip, StringBuilder characterBuffer, int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer, boolean endOfStreamHit)
      Use this method if you either want to skip some characters (SKIP) or don't skip any characters as there are no modifiable characters in the buffer left but the end of stream is not hit (SKIP), or don't skip any characters as there are no modifiable characters in the buffer left and the end of stream is hit (STOP).

    • Method Detail

      • skipEntireBuffer

        public AfterModification skipEntireBuffer(StringBuilder characterBuffer,
                                 int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer,
                                 boolean endOfStreamHit)
        Parameters:
        characterBuffer -
        firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer -
        endOfStreamHit -
        Returns:
        Returns a modification that skips some characters (SKIP), i.e. marks them as not modifiable, or returns a STOP.

      • skipOrStop

        public AfterModification skipOrStop(int numberOfCharactersToSkip,
                           StringBuilder characterBuffer,
                           int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer,
                           boolean endOfStreamHit)
        Use this method if you
        • either want to skip some characters (SKIP) or don't skip any characters as there are no modifiable characters in the buffer left but the end of stream is not hit (SKIP), or
        • don't skip any characters as there are no modifiable characters in the buffer left and the end of stream is hit (STOP).
        Parameters:
        numberOfCharactersToSkip - the number of characters to skip. This must greater than zero unless the end of the stream is hit or the buffer does not contain modifiable characters.
        characterBuffer -
        firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer -
        endOfStreamHit - See parameter in Modifier.modify(StringBuilder, int, boolean).
        Returns:
        Returns a modification that skips some characters (SKIP), i.e. marks them as not modifiable, or returns a STOP.

      • skip

        public AfterModification skip(int numberOfCharactersToSkip,
                     StringBuilder characterBuffer,
                     int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer,
                     boolean endOfStreamHit)
        Skips some characters if there are some in the buffer. This method requires that are modifiable characters somewhere in the stream.
        Parameters:
        numberOfCharactersToSkip - the number of characters to skip. This must greater than zero unless the end of stream is not hit and there no modifiable characters in the buffer.
        characterBuffer -
        firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer -
        endOfStreamHit -
        Returns:
        Returns a modification that skips some characters (SKIP).

      • fetchMoreInput

        public AfterModification fetchMoreInput(int numberOfCharactersToSkip,
                               StringBuilder characterBuffer,
                               int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer,
                               boolean endOfStreamHit)
        This method
        • skips the given characters to use the character buffer as optimal as possible,
        • checks whether skipping and the current value of AfterModification.getNewNumberOfChars() would fetch more input in the character buffer. If not then AfterModification.getNewNumberOfChars() is doubled until the number would fetch more input in the character buffer.
        Parameters:
        numberOfCharactersToSkip -
        characterBuffer -
        firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer -
        endOfStreamHit -
        Returns:
        Returns a SKIP or MODIFY AGAIN IMMEDIATELY.

      • modifyAgainImmediately

        public AfterModification modifyAgainImmediately(int newNumberOfChars_,
                                       int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer)
        Use this method if you want to request another number of characters from the ModifyingReader and re-try a modification (MODIFY AGAIN IMMEDIATELY).
        Returns:
        Returns a modification that requests another number of characters from the ModifyingReader and requests a call to Modifier.modify(StringBuilder, int, boolean) via AfterModification.isModifyAgainImmediately().

      • stop

        public AfterModification stop(StringBuilder characterBuffer,
                     int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer,
                     boolean endOfStreamHit)
        Parameters:
        characterBuffer -
        firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer -
        endOfStreamHit -
        Returns:
        Returns an AfterModification that is appropriate if the end of stream is hit and there are no more modifiable characters and you don't want to add characters at the end of the stream. If there are still modifiable characters in the stream yet, then this method will throw an exception.

      • getNewNumberOfChars

        public int getNewNumberOfChars()
        Returns:
        Returns the newNumberOfChars.

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        See Also:
        Object.toString()
